title: Air Force looking at next steps on Space Command basing decision
summary: “We're all hoping to move forward with a final decision as quickly as we can," Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said regarding the relocation of U.S. Space Command

title: Inmarsat agrees to move ground station out of the Netherlands
summary: Inmarsat is seeking permission from Greece to move a ground station there from the Netherlands, which wants to sell the C-band spectrum the site uses for maritime safety services to 5G wireless operators.

title: Pace of work put strain on private astronaut mission to ISS
summary: The private astronauts who spent two weeks on the International Space Station in April said they tried to pack too much into their schedules while on the station, putting a strain on both themselves and the professional astronauts there.

title: SpaceX launches 2,500th Starlink satellite in third back-to-back mission
summary: SpaceX launched its third back-to-back Starlink mission in barely a fortnight Friday. Falcon 9 lifted off from Vandenberg Space Force Base at 3:07 PM PDT (22:07 UTC) to add another 53 satellites to SpaceX’s low Earth orbit communications constellation, bringing the total launched to over 2,500.

title: Chinese startup suffers third consecutive launch failure
summary: A small satellite launcher developed by the Chinese startup iSpace failed to place its Earth observing payload into orbit Friday, the third consecutive failure for the company’s Hyperbola 1 rocket.

title: SpaceX planning two Starlink launches Friday and Saturday, weather permitting
summary: Weather permitting, SpaceX teams in California and Florida plan to launch two Falcon 9 rockets Friday and Saturday, each hauling 53 more Starlink satellites to join the company’s global broadband network.

title: Chinese rocket company suffers third consecutive launch failure
summary: An orbital launch attempt by Chinese startup iSpace ended in failure early Friday, following on from two failures last year.

title: SpaceX’s repaired Starship booster survives back-to-back cryoproof tests
summary: SpaceX’s upgraded Starship booster has completed a second and third cryogenic proof test in rapid succession after undergoing repairs to fix damage...

title: ISS partnership feeling some effects of sanctions on Russia
summary: While operations of the International Space Station continue without “serious interruptions,” sanctions on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine are starting to have an effect on some activities, NASA’s safety advisers said.

title: Arctic connectivity competition is heating up
summary: Satellite operators are venturing north to improve connectivity as the changing climate drives demand for more bandwidth in one of Earth’s last remaining frontiers.
